name: Easy Proud to be an AMERICAN 2 Trivia Quiz | Wordplay for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: Using only letters from AMERICAN, find a 4-letter word for a curved stick that can be used to help someone walk.
questions.explanation:
Cane.

	Canes are helpful because they can stabilize you as you walk.  If someone has a bad knee, hip, back, or whatever, they may need a cane to help them walk.  Canes can also be peppermint candy canes, common treats around Christmas time.

questions.text: Find a 5-letter word, using only letters from AMERICAN, that means to grind up into very small pieces.
questions.explanation:
Mince.

	To mince something is to finely grind it.  'Mince' is also used to refer to ground meat.  Minced meat pie is a pie made from very finely ground meat.

questions.text: Which word of 4 letters would mean a manmade cave or pit where ore is found, using only letters from AMERICAN?
questions.explanation:
Mine.

	Mines are usually manmade caves, and depending on the location, you can get all sorts of gems and minerals.  For instance, there are gold mines, diamond mines, and ruby mines.  A mine can also be a bomb, as in a mine field.  Finally, mine can refer to something belonging to me, as opposed to yours.

questions.text: Most people go by this, and have a first and last one, and many also have a middle one.  This word is 4 letters long, and only uses letters found in AMERICAN.
questions.explanation:
Name.

	To name something or someone would be to give a title to it.  For instance, when a baby is born, they may NAME him Jimmy.  Name can also be a noun, meaning the actual title given.  So Jimmy would be the name as well.

questions.text: Using only letters from AMERICAN, find a 3-letter word for the stuff we breathe in.
questions.explanation:
Air.

	More specifically, we breathe oxygen.  The air around us has several different elements, including hydrogen, oxygen, and nitrogen.  However, we only use the oxygen in our bodies.

questions.text: Use only letters from AMERICAN to find this word of 6 letters: a crocodile-like reptile.
questions.explanation:
Caiman.

	Caimans are small crocodilians.  They look much like crocodiles and alligators, except that they are much smaller.  Some caiman species have very skinny snouts, too.

questions.text: Using only letters from AMERICAN, find a 3-letter word for a male sheep.
questions.explanation:
Ram.

	Rams are male sheep and ewes are female sheep.  A ram can also be something used to break down a door or wall, and it can also be the act of breaking down a door or wall.

questions.text: Using only letters from AMERICAN, find a word meaning ocean-dwelling, that is 6 letters long.
questions.explanation:
Marine.

	Marine means "referring to the sea".  Marine animals, for instance, mean they are animals that live in the sea.  Marine biologists are scientists who study sea animals.

questions.text: Find a 4-letter word, using only letters from AMERICAN, that means either an average, or not nice.
questions.explanation:
Mean.

	Mean means the same thing as average in math.  For instance, the average score of a test is also the mean of a test.  To be mean is to treat people badly, and not nicely.

questions.text: Find a 6-letter word, using only letters from AMERICAN, that means to stay where you are.
questions.explanation:
Remain.

	To remain means to stay.  Remains can mean stays or leftovers.  For instance, after a meal, the remains might be whatever was left on plates and not eaten.
